required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Test the Effects of Riociguat in Patients With Pulmonary Hypertension Associated With Left Ventricular Systolic Dysfunction
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Double Blind, Placebo Controlled, Parallel Group, Multi-center Study to Evaluate the Hemodynamic Effects of Riociguat (BAY 63-2521) as Well as Safety and Kinetics in Patients With Pulmonary Hypertension Associated With Left Ventricular Systolic Dysfunction

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to assess whether increasing oral doses of Riociguat are safe and improve the well-being, symptoms and outcome in patients with pulmonary hypertension associated with left ventricular systolic dysfunction

detailed_description.textblock: Pharmacokinetics parameters were regarded as exploratory parameters. Adverse event data will be covered in Adverse events section.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Pulmonary Artery Mean Pressure (PAPmean) at Rest - Change From Baseline to Week 16
primary_outcome.description: Mean pulmonary arterial pressure (PAPmean) is a directly measured hemodynamic parameter. PAPmean is recorded during a right heart catheterization.

secondary_outcome.measure: Venous Oxygen Saturation (SvO2) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: The mixed venous oxygen saturation rate (SvO2) is a directly measured hemodynamic parameter. SvO2 is recorded during a right heart catheterization.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pulmonary Vascular Resistance (PVR) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: The pulmonary vascular resistance (PVR) is a calculated hemodynamic parameter. PVR is derived from the directly measured parameters mean pulmonary arterial pressure (PAPmean) and pulmonary capillary wedge pressure (PCWP), divided by the cardiac output (CO). PVR and PAPmean are acquired during a right heart catheterization. CO is a calculated hemodynamic parameter, too. Formula: PVR = 80*(PAPmean - PCWP)/CO

secondary_outcome.measure: Pulmonary Vascular Resistance Index (PVRi) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: The pulmonary vascular resistance index (PVRi) is a calculated hemodynamic parameter. PVRi is derived from the pulmonary vascular resistance (PVR) normalized by the body surface area (BSA). Formula: PVRi = 80*(PAPmean - PCWP)*BSA/CO

secondary_outcome.measure: Systemic Vascular Resistance (SVR) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: The systemic vascular resistance (SVR) is a calculated hemodynamic parameter. SVR is derived from the directly measured parameter mean right atrial pressure (RAPmean) and the calculated parameter mean systemic arterial pressure (SAPmean) divided by the cardiac output (CO). RAPmean is acquired during a right heart catheterization. CO is a calculated hemodynamic parameter, too. Formula: SVR = 80*(SAPmean - RAPmean)/CO

secondary_outcome.measure: Systemic Vascular Resistance Index (SVRi) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: The systemic vascular resistance index (SVRi) is a calculated hemodynamic parameter. SVRi is derived from the systemic vascular resistance (SVR) normalized by the body surface area (BSA). Formula: SVRi = 80*(SAPmean - RAPmean)*BSA/CO

secondary_outcome.measure: Transpulmonary Pressure Gradient (TPG) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: The transpulmonary pressure gradient (TPG) is a calculated hemodynamic parameter. TPG is calculated from the directly measured parameters mean pulmonary arterial pressure (PAPmean) and pulmonary capillary wedge pressure (PCWP). These 2 parameters are acquired during a right heart catheterization. Formula: TPG = PAPmean - PCWP

secondary_outcome.measure: Pulmonary Capillary Wedge Pressure (PCWP) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: Pulmonary capillary wedge pressure (PCWP) is a directly measured hemodynamic parameter acquired during a right heart catheterization.

secondary_outcome.measure: Tricuspid Annular Plane Systolic Excursion (TAPSE) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: The tricuspid annular plane systolic excursion (TAPSE) is a measured echocardiography parameter. It is acquired during a non-invasive echocardiography examination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Systolic Pulmonary Arterial Pressure (PAPsyst) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: Systolic pulmonary arterial pressure (PAPsyst) is a directly measured hemodynamic parameter acquired during a right heart catheterization.

secondary_outcome.measure: Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: The left ventricular ejection fraction work index (LVEF) is a calculated echocardiography parameter. LVEF is derived from the directly measured parameters left ventricular end-diastolic volume (LVEDV) and left ventricular end-systolic volume (LVESV). These 2 parameters are acquired during a non-invasive echocardiography examination. Formula: LEVF = 100*(LVEDV - LVESV)/LVEDV

secondary_outcome.measure: Left Ventricular End-systolic Volume (LVESV) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: Left ventricular end-systolic volume (LVESV) is a measured echocardiography parameter. It is acquired during a non-invasive echocardiography examination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Left Ventricular End-diastolic Volume (LVEDV) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: Left ventricular end-diastolic volume (LVEDV) is a measured echocardiography parameter. It is acquired during a non-invasive echocardiography examination.

secondary_outcome.measure: E-wave Deceleration Time - Change From Baseline to Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: E-wave deceleration time is a measured echocardiography parameter. It is acquired during a non-invasive echocardiography examination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Ratio of Mitral Peak Velocity of Early Filling to Mitral Peak Velocity of Late Filling (E/A) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: E/A ratio is a measured echocardiography parameter and describes the ratio of mitral peak velocity of early filling to mitral peak velocity of late filling. It is acquired during a non-invasive echocardiography examination.

secondary_outcome.measure: 6-minute Walking Distance (6MWD) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: 6-minute walking distance (6MWD) is a measure for the objective evaluation of a patient's functional exercise capacity.

secondary_outcome.measure: WHO (World Health Organization) Functional Class - Change From Baseline to Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: The WHO functional assessment of pulmonary arterial hypertension ranged from functional class I (Patients with PH but without resulting limitation of physical activity) to class IV (Patients with PH with inability to carry out any physical activity without symptoms. These patients manifest signs of right-heart failure.). Changes to a lower WHO functional class resemble improvement, changes to a higher functional class resemble deterioration of PAH.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Clinical Worsening
secondary_outcome.description: The combined endpoint "time to clinical worsening", made up of the following components, defined by the first occurrence: all cause mortality, including cardiovascular mortality; first hospitalization for a cardiovascular event, including heart failure, acute myocardial infarction, stroke or ventricular arrhythmia; upgrade of the HTx (heart transplantation) status to next higher level; need for IV diuretics; persistent worsening of WHO functional class due to deterioration of PH or cardiac function.

secondary_outcome.measure: Borg CR 10 Scale - Change From Baseline to Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: The Borg CR10 Scale is a patient reported outcome measure used in clinical diagnosis of e.g. breathlessness and dyspnea. It documents the patient's exertion during a physical test. Low values indicate low levels of exertion, high values indicate more intense exertion reported by the patient. The score ranges from 0 ("Nothing at all") to 10 ("Extremely strong - Maximal").

secondary_outcome.measure: EQ-5D Utility Score - Change From Baseline to Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: EQ-5D utility score is a Quality-of-Life patient reported outcome measure. An increase in the utility score represents an improvement in quality of life. The score ranges from 0 (worst imaginable health state) to 100 (best imaginable health state).

secondary_outcome.measure: Minnesota Living With Heart Failure Questionnaire (MLHF) Score - Change From Baseline to Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: The self-reported Minnesota Living with Heart Failure questionnaire (MLHF) is designed to measure the effects of PH and PH-specific treatments on an individual's quality of life. The MLHF total score can range from 0 (best) to 105 (worst).

secondary_outcome.measure: Cystatin C - Change From Baseline to Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: Cystatin C is a biomarker for predicting new onset or deteriorating cardiovascular disease.

secondary_outcome.measure: N-terminal Pro-brain Natriuretic Peptide (NT-pro BNP) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: N-terminal pro-brain natriuretic peptide (NT-pro BNP) levels in the blood are used for screening, diagnosis of acute congestive heart failure (CHF) and may be useful to establish prognosis in heart failure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Troponin T - Change From Baseline to Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: Troponin T is a cardiac-specific protein which is released from damaged or injured heart muscle cells.

secondary_outcome.measure: Asymmetric Dimethylarginine (ADMA) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: Asymmetric dimethylarginine (ADMA) is an endogenous inhibitor of nitric oxides. Recent clinical studies have indicated that ADMA may have diagnostic relevance as a novel cardiovascular risk marker.

secondary_outcome.measure: Osteopontin - Change From Baseline to Week 16
secondary_outcome.description: Osteopontin is a cytokine-like pro-fibrotic mediator, which is expressed in cardiovascular tissues. Its expression is induced by increased pressure and volume load in the myocardium, kidney and lung. Therefore, osteopontin may be used as a prognostic marker in patients with cardiovascular diseases.

arm_group.description: Participants received riociguat up to 2 mg three times per day (tid) (increasing from 0.5 to 1 to 2 mg).
Participants received riociguat up to 1 mg tid (increasing from 0.5 to 1 mg).
Participants received riociguat 0.5 mg tid (fixed dose).

intervention.description: up to 2 mg three times a day (increasing from 0.5 to 1 to 2 mg)
up to 1 mg three times a day (increasing from 0.5 to 1 mg)
fixed 0.5 mg three times a day

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and female patients with symptomatic pulmonary hypertension due to left ventricular systolic dysfunction despite optimized heart failure therapy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Types of pulmonary hypertension other than group 2.1 of Dana Point Classification

link.description: Click here and search for drug information provided by the FDA.
Click here and search for information on any recalls, market or product safety alerts by the FDA which might have occurred with this product.

results_reference.citation: Ghio S, Bonderman D, Felix SB, Ghofrani HA, Michelakis ED, Mitrovic V, Oudiz RJ, Frey R, Roessig L, Semigran MJ. Left ventricular systolic dysfunction associated with pulmonary hypertension riociguat trial (LEPHT): rationale and design. Eur J Heart Fail. 2012 Aug;14(8):946-53. doi: 10.1093/eurjhf/hfs071. Epub 2012 Jun 20.

Bonderman D, Ghio S, Felix SB, Ghofrani HA, Michelakis E, Mitrovic V, Oudiz RJ, Boateng F, Scalise AV, Roessig L, Semigran MJ; Left Ventricular Systolic Dysfunction Associated With Pulmonary Hypertension Riociguat Trial (LEPHT) Study Group. Riociguat for patients with pulmonary hypertension caused by systolic left ventricular dysfunction: a phase IIb double-blind, randomized, placebo-controlled, dose-ranging hemodynamic study. Circulation. 2013 Jul 30;128(5):502-11. doi: 10.1161/CIRCULATIONAHA.113.001458. Epub 2013 Jun 17.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Only subjects with symptomatic pulmonary hypertension associated with left ventricular systolic dysfunction (PH-sLVD) could participate in this study. Subjects must have been pre-treated with optimized CHF therapy.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 301 subjects were screened in 84 study centers in 18 countries worldwide. 99 of the 301 screened subjects were not randomized (adverse event [1], protocol violation [1], screen failure [87], withdrawal by subject [10]). Of the 202 subjects randomized, one subject did not receive any study medication.

group.title: Riociguat (Adempas, BAY63-2521) up to 2 mg
group.description: Participants received riociguat up to 2 mg three times per day (tid) (increasing from 0.5 to 1 to 2 mg).

measure.description: LVEF is a calculated echocardiography parameter.

WHO (World Health Organization) functional class
measure.description: The WHO functional assessment of pulmonary arterial hypertension ranged from functional class I (Patients with PH but without resulting limitation of physical activity) to class IV (Patients with PH with inability to carry out any physical activity without symptoms. These patients manifest signs of right-heart failure.). Changes to a lower WHO functional class resemble improvement, changes to a higher functional class resemble deterioration of pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH).

Number of participants with pacemaker rhythm
Baseline drug and device therapy
measure.description: A single patient could have more than one drug and device therapy.

outcome.title: Pulmonary Artery Mean Pressure (PAPmean) at Rest - Change From Baseline to Week 16
outcome.description: Mean pulmonary arterial pressure (PAPmean) is a directly measured hemodynamic parameter. PAPmean is recorded during a right heart catheterization.
outcome.population: Per-protocol set (PPS) - A subject was included in the PPS if he/she was valid for SAF [safety analysis set]/ITT and showed no major protocol deviations affecting efficacy. Only participants with a baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement were included in this analysis.

measure.title: Tricuspid Annular Plane Systolic Excursion (TAPSE) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
measure.description: The tricuspid annular plane systolic excursion (TAPSE) is a measured echocardiography parameter. It is acquired during a non-invasive echocardiography examination.
measure.population: Per-protocol set (PPS) - A subject was included in the PPS if he/she was valid for SAF/ITT and showed no major protocol deviations affecting efficacy. Only participants with a baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement were included in this analysis.

outcome.title: Systolic Pulmonary Arterial Pressure (PAPsyst) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
outcome.description: Systolic pulmonary arterial pressure (PAPsyst) is a directly measured hemodynamic parameter acquired during a right heart catheterization.
outcome.population: Per-protocol set (PPS) - A subject was included in the PPS if he/she was valid for SAF/ITT and showed no major protocol deviations affecting efficacy. Only participants with a baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement were included in this analysis.

group.title: Riociguat (Adempas, BAY63-2521) up to 2 mg
group.description: Participants received riociguat up to 2 mg three times per day (tid) (increasing from 0.5 to 1 to 2 mg).

group.title: Riociguat (Adempas, BAY63-2521) up to 1 mg
group.description: Participants received riociguat up to 1 mg tid (increasing from 0.5 to 1 mg).

group.title: Riociguat (Adempas, BAY63-2521) Fixed 0.5 mg
group.description: Participants received riociguat 0.5 mg tid (fixed dose).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants received placebo tid.

measure.title: Systolic Pulmonary Arterial Pressure (PAPsyst) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
measure.description: Systolic pulmonary arterial pressure (PAPsyst) is a directly measured hemodynamic parameter acquired during a right heart catheterization.
measure.population: Per-protocol set (PPS) - A subject was included in the PPS if he/she was valid for SAF/ITT and showed no major protocol deviations affecting efficacy. Only participants with a baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement were included in this analysis.

outcome.title: Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
outcome.description: The left ventricular ejection fraction work index (LVEF) is a calculated echocardiography parameter. LVEF is derived from the directly measured parameters left ventricular end-diastolic volume (LVEDV) and left ventricular end-systolic volume (LVESV). These 2 parameters are acquired during a non-invasive echocardiography examination. Formula: LEVF = 100*(LVEDV - LVESV)/LVEDV
outcome.population: Per-protocol set (PPS) - A subject was included in the PPS if he/she was valid for SAF/ITT and showed no major protocol deviations affecting efficacy. Only participants with a baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement were included in this analysis.

group.title: Riociguat (Adempas, BAY63-2521) up to 2 mg
group.description: Participants received riociguat up to 2 mg three times per day (tid) (increasing from 0.5 to 1 to 2 mg).

group.title: Riociguat (Adempas, BAY63-2521) up to 1 mg
group.description: Participants received riociguat up to 1 mg tid (increasing from 0.5 to 1 mg).

group.title: Riociguat (Adempas, BAY63-2521) Fixed 0.5 mg
group.description: Participants received riociguat 0.5 mg tid (fixed dose).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants received placebo tid.

measure.title: Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
measure.description: The left ventricular ejection fraction work index (LVEF) is a calculated echocardiography parameter. LVEF is derived from the directly measured parameters left ventricular end-diastolic volume (LVEDV) and left ventricular end-systolic volume (LVESV). These 2 parameters are acquired during a non-invasive echocardiography examination. Formula: LEVF = 100*(LVEDV - LVESV)/LVEDV
measure.population: Per-protocol set (PPS) - A subject was included in the PPS if he/she was valid for SAF/ITT and showed no major protocol deviations affecting efficacy. Only participants with a baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement were included in this analysis.

outcome.title: Ratio of Mitral Peak Velocity of Early Filling to Mitral Peak Velocity of Late Filling (E/A) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
outcome.description: E/A ratio is a measured echocardiography parameter and describes the ratio of mitral peak velocity of early filling to mitral peak velocity of late filling. It is acquired during a non-invasive echocardiography examination.
outcome.population: Per-protocol set (PPS) - A subject was included in the PPS if he/she was valid for SAF/ITT and showed no major protocol deviations affecting efficacy. Only participants with a baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement were included in this analysis.

outcome.title: 6-minute Walking Distance (6MWD) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
outcome.description: 6-minute walking distance (6MWD) is a measure for the objective evaluation of a patient's functional exercise capacity.
outcome.population: Per-protocol set (PPS) - A subject was included in the PPS if he/she was valid for SAF/ITT and showed no major protocol deviations affecting efficacy. Only participants with a baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement were included in this analysis.

measure.title: 6-minute Walking Distance (6MWD) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
measure.description: 6-minute walking distance (6MWD) is a measure for the objective evaluation of a patient's functional exercise capacity.
measure.population: Per-protocol set (PPS) - A subject was included in the PPS if he/she was valid for SAF/ITT and showed no major protocol deviations affecting efficacy. Only participants with a baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement were included in this analysis.

outcome.title: WHO (World Health Organization) Functional Class - Change From Baseline to Week 16
outcome.description: The WHO functional assessment of pulmonary arterial hypertension ranged from functional class I (Patients with PH but without resulting limitation of physical activity) to class IV (Patients with PH with inability to carry out any physical activity without symptoms. These patients manifest signs of right-heart failure.). Changes to a lower WHO functional class resemble improvement, changes to a higher functional class resemble deterioration of PAH.
outcome.population: Per-protocol set (PPS) - A subject was included in the PPS if he/she was valid for SAF/ITT and showed no major protocol deviations affecting efficacy. Only participants with a baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement were included in this analysis.

group.description: Participants received riociguat up to 1 mg tid (increasing from 0.5 to 1 mg).

group.title: Riociguat (Adempas, BAY63-2521) Fixed 0.5 mg
group.description: Participants received riociguat 0.5 mg tid (fixed dose).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants received placebo tid.

measure.title: WHO (World Health Organization) Functional Class - Change From Baseline to Week 16
measure.description: The WHO functional assessment of pulmonary arterial hypertension ranged from functional class I (Patients with PH but without resulting limitation of physical activity) to class IV (Patients with PH with inability to carry out any physical activity without symptoms. These patients manifest signs of right-heart failure.). Changes to a lower WHO functional class resemble improvement, changes to a higher functional class resemble deterioration of PAH.
measure.population: Per-protocol set (PPS) - A subject was included in the PPS if he/she was valid for SAF/ITT and showed no major protocol deviations affecting efficacy. Only participants with a baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement were included in this analysis.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Clinical Worsening
outcome.description: The combined endpoint “time to clinical worsening”, made up of the following components, defined by the first occurrence: all cause mortality, including cardiovascular mortality; first hospitalization for a cardiovascular event, including heart failure, acute myocardial infarction, stroke or ventricular arrhythmia; upgrade of the HTx (heart transplantation) status to next higher level; need for IV diuretics; persistent worsening of WHO functional class due to deterioration of PH or cardiac function.
outcome.population: Intent to Treat (ITT) - a randomized participant was valid for ITT analyses if at least one dose of study medication was administered. Only participants with a baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement were included in the analysis.

group.description: Participants received riociguat up to 1 mg tid (increasing from 0.5 to 1 mg).

group.title: Riociguat (Adempas, BAY63-2521) Fixed 0.5 mg
group.description: Participants received riociguat 0.5 mg tid (fixed dose).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants received placebo tid.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Clinical Worsening
measure.description: The combined endpoint “time to clinical worsening”, made up of the following components, defined by the first occurrence: all cause mortality, including cardiovascular mortality; first hospitalization for a cardiovascular event, including heart failure, acute myocardial infarction, stroke or ventricular arrhythmia; upgrade of the HTx (heart transplantation) status to next higher level; need for IV diuretics; persistent worsening of WHO functional class due to deterioration of PH or cardiac function.
measure.population: Intent to Treat (ITT) - a randomized participant was valid for ITT analyses if at least one dose of study medication was administered. Only participants with a baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Borg CR 10 Scale - Change From Baseline to Week 16
outcome.description: The Borg CR10 Scale is a patient reported outcome measure used in clinical diagnosis of e.g. breathlessness and dyspnea. It documents the patient's exertion during a physical test. Low values indicate low levels of exertion, high values indicate more intense exertion reported by the patient. The score ranges from 0 ("Nothing at all") to 10 (“Extremely strong – Maximal”).
outcome.population: Per-protocol set (PPS) - A subject was included in the PPS if he/she was valid for SAF/ITT and showed no major protocol deviations affecting efficacy. Only participants with a baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement were included in this analysis.

group.description: Participants received riociguat up to 1 mg tid (increasing from 0.5 to 1 mg).

group.title: Riociguat (Adempas, BAY63-2521) Fixed 0.5 mg
group.description: Participants received riociguat 0.5 mg tid (fixed dose).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants received placebo tid.

measure.title: Borg CR 10 Scale - Change From Baseline to Week 16
measure.description: The Borg CR10 Scale is a patient reported outcome measure used in clinical diagnosis of e.g. breathlessness and dyspnea. It documents the patient's exertion during a physical test. Low values indicate low levels of exertion, high values indicate more intense exertion reported by the patient. The score ranges from 0 ("Nothing at all") to 10 (“Extremely strong – Maximal”).

outcome.title: EQ-5D Utility Score - Change From Baseline to Week 16
outcome.description: EQ-5D utility score is a Quality-of-Life patient reported outcome measure. An increase in the utility score represents an improvement in quality of life. The score ranges from 0 (worst imaginable health state) to 100 (best imaginable health state).
outcome.population: Per-protocol set (PPS) - A subject was included in the PPS if he/she was valid for SAF/ITT and showed no major protocol deviations affecting efficacy. Only participants with a baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement were included in this analysis.

outcome.title: Minnesota Living With Heart Failure Questionnaire (MLHF) Score - Change From Baseline to Week 16
outcome.description: The self-reported Minnesota Living with Heart Failure questionnaire (MLHF) is designed to measure the effects of PH and PH-specific treatments on an individual’s quality of life. The MLHF total score can range from 0 (best) to 105 (worst).
outcome.population: Per-protocol set (PPS) - A subject was included in the PPS if he/she was valid for SAF/ITT and showed no major protocol deviations affecting efficacy. Only participants with a baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement were included in this analysis.

outcome.title: N-terminal Pro-brain Natriuretic Peptide (NT-pro BNP) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
outcome.description: N-terminal pro-brain natriuretic peptide (NT-pro BNP) levels in the blood are used for screening, diagnosis of acute congestive heart failure (CHF) and may be useful to establish prognosis in heart failure.
outcome.population: Per-protocol set (PPS) - A subject was included in the PPS if he/she was valid for SAF/ITT and showed no major protocol deviations affecting efficacy. Only participants with a baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement were included in this analysis.

outcome.title: Troponin T - Change From Baseline to Week 16
outcome.description: Troponin T is a cardiac-specific protein which is released from damaged or injured heart muscle cells.
outcome.population: Per-protocol set (PPS) - A subject was included in the PPS if he/she was valid for SAF/ITT and showed no major protocol deviations affecting efficacy. Only participants with a baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement were included in this analysis.

outcome.title: Asymmetric Dimethylarginine (ADMA) - Change From Baseline to Week 16
outcome.description: Asymmetric dimethylarginine (ADMA) is an endogenous inhibitor of nitric oxides. Recent clinical studies have indicated that ADMA may have diagnostic relevance as a novel cardiovascular risk marker.
outcome.population: Per-protocol set (PPS) - A subject was included in the PPS if he/she was valid for SAF/ITT and showed no major protocol deviations affecting efficacy. Only participants with a baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement were included in this analysis.

outcome.title: Osteopontin - Change From Baseline to Week 16
outcome.description: Osteopontin is a cytokine-like pro-fibrotic mediator, which is expressed in cardiovascular tissues. Its expression is induced by increased pressure and volume load in the myocardium, kidney and lung. Therefore, osteopontin may be used as a prognostic marker in patients with cardiovascular diseases.
outcome.population: Per-protocol set (PPS) - A subject was included in the PPS if he/she was valid for SAF/ITT and showed no major protocol deviations affecting efficacy. Only participants with a baseline and at least one post-baseline measurement were included in this analysis.

reported_events.time_frame: All Adverse Events occurring between the subject has signed the informed consent and 30 days after the definite stop of study medication (over a period approximately 25 months) were reported.

group.description: Participants received placebo tid

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Investigative Site, Institution and/or Principal Investigator shall furnish the Sponsor with a copy of any proposed publication of material at least sixty (60) days in advance of the date of submission for publication or presentation.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Subjects had advanced disease and were heavily pretreated. Baseline values were not comparable between treatment groups.
